    • Method Detail

      • receiveDataPacket

        public PacketResult receiveDataPacket(RawPacket inPkt)
        Description copied from interface: IPluginOutDataPacketService
        Handler for receiving the packet. The SAL layer can signal back to the southbound plugin if the packet has been consumed or can go for further processing. Usually after SAL processing probably there is no other processing to be done, but just in case there is chain the return code can be used. The protocol plugin is supposed to deliver a packet with the IncomingNodeConnector set
        Specified by:
        receiveDataPacket in interface IPluginOutDataPacketService
        Parameters:
        inPkt - Packet received
        Returns:
        An indication if the packet should still be processed or we should stop it.

      • transmitDataPacket

        public void transmitDataPacket(RawPacket outPkt)
        Description copied from interface: IDataPacketService
        Transmit a data Packet. Transmission will ONLY happen if the RawPacket has the OutgoingNodeConnector set else of course transmission cannot happen.
        Specified by:
        transmitDataPacket in interface IDataPacketService
        Parameters:
        outPkt - Packet to be transmitted out

      • decodeDataPacket

        public Packet decodeDataPacket(RawPacket pkt)
        Description copied from interface: IDataPacketService
        Decode a Data Packet received as a raw stream
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • encodeDataPacket

        public RawPacket encodeDataPacket(Packet pkt)
        Description copied from interface: IDataPacketService
        Encode a Formatted Data Packet in a raw bytestream
        Specified by:
        encodeDataPacket in interface IDataPacketService
        Parameters:
        pkt - Formatted Data Packet to be encoded
        Returns:
        a RawPacket representation, good for transmission purpose
